title: FreeBSD Kernel sendmsg System Call Time-Of-Check Time-Of-Use Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of FreeBSD Kernel. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system in order to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the handling of arguments to the sendmsg system call. The issue results from the lack of proper locking when performing operations on an object. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to escalate privileges and execute code in the context of the kernel.
addtionnal_details: FreeBSD has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://www.freebsd.org/security/advisories/FreeBSD-SA-20:23.sendmsg.asc
timeline:
2020-07-24 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2020-08-06 - Coordinated public release of advisory
